title: 108_s851
content: The "Child Custody Protection Act" may be cited as the short title. Title 18, United States Code, is amended to include a new chapter on the transportation of minors in circumvention of certain laws relating to abortion. The "Child Custody Protection Act" introduces penalties for knowingly transporting a minor across state lines to obtain an abortion without parental consent, in violation of state laws requiring parental involvement in the decision. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for an abortion without parental consent or judicial authorization, except in cases where the minor's life is endangered by a physical condition related to the pregnancy. Transporting a minor in violation of this law is not subject to prosecution, and an affirmative defense can be made if the defendant reasonably believed they were acting within the law. The "Child Custody Protection Act" prohibits transporting a minor across state lines for an abortion without parental consent or judicial authorization. An affirmative defense is available if the defendant reasonably believed they were acting within the law. Parents can seek relief in a civil action for harm caused by violations of the law. Parents can seek relief in a civil action for harm caused by violations of the law. Definitions for parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision are provided in subsection (e). The "Child Custody Protection Act" defines key terms such as 'parent', 'minor', and 'State' in relation to parental involvement in a minor's abortion decision. The "Child Custody Protection Act" addresses transportation of minors in circumvention of laws relating to abortion.
